bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Staige D. Blackford, December 13, 1947

div1.p: Hench discusses the possibility of making Kean, Cooke, and Moran honorary members of Alpha Omega Alpha. He informs Blackford that Landon Reed, a cousin of Blackford, would enjoy a visit from him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Staige D. Blackford, December 13, 1947
div1.opener:
December 13, 1947
Dr. Staige D. Blackford
University of Virginia Hospital
Charlottesville, Virginia
My dear Staige:
div1.p:
It was nice indeed to see you again. I enclose a carbon of the
letter I have just sent to Mr. Owen.

Let me make this suggestion regarding honorary memberships also
to you, but of course I don't want to embarrass anybody.

On our visit with General and Mrs. Reed (Walter Reed's son) Mrs.
Reed straightened out the matter of your relationship. As soon as she heard
that I had visited the University, she asked if I knew you, which I shyly
admitted. She asked all about you. She knows the relationship quite well.
Apparently you are her (not his) first or second cousin. She is quite anxious
to see you some time and does hope that you can visit them the next time you
are in Washington. I am sure you would enjoy it heartily. Both General and
Mrs. Reed are delightful people and if they invite you for dinner you will
have a delightful time. Unfortunately, they don't accept invitations out.

If anything more comes of my little off-the-record remarks during
my talk suggesting a memorial to Walter Reed be erected at the University,
I should certainly be interested to know. It seems to me that the Medical
School certainly ought to have a significant memorial to its greatest alumnus
especially when so many others have honored him.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
Enclosure
